qas.question: A ball hits a switch and the light turns on. If the ball never hits the switch, can the light still turn on by itself?
A toy car bumps a button and the music plays. If the car never bumps the button, will the music play by itself?
A hand presses a bell and it rings. If the hand does not press it, can the bell ring on its own?
A ball knocks over a block tower and it falls. If the ball does not hit it, will the tower fall by itself?
A finger flips a switch and the fan starts. If no one flips the switch, can the fan start by itself?
A dog pushes a door and it opens. If the dog does not push it, will the door open by itself?
A marble hits a lever and a toy pops up. If the marble never hits the lever, will the toy pop up by itself?
A spoon taps a xylophone bar and it makes a sound. If the spoon never taps it, can the sound happen by itself?
A child steps on a pedal and bubbles start. If the child does not step, will bubbles start anyway?
A wind-up key is turned and the toy walks. If no one turns the key, will it walk on its own?
A cup is tipped and water spills out. If the cup is not tipped, will the water spill by itself?
